body_html:
If you mean comparison to bazel built pip package, any cmakefile with a list in them can benefit.
However, if you mean just comparing to the file tree, we already run the full cmake build itself, so i dont think we need an extra test for comparing cmakefile entries to the files in the tree.

Response to deleted comment:
tf_py_test is just a convenience wrapper around py_test rule which hides some complexity for a few of our options like xla and grpc. In this case, we definitely do not need it.

body:
If you mean comparison to bazel built pip package, any cmakefile with a list in them can benefit.
However, if you mean just comparing to the file tree, we already run the full cmake build itself, so i dont think we need an extra test for comparing cmakefile entries to the files in the tree.

Response to deleted comment:
`tf_py_test` is just a convenience wrapper around `py_test` rule which hides some complexity for a few of our options like xla and grpc. In this case, we definitely do not need it.
